verses.kjv: Now Joshua was old and stricken in years; and the LORD said unto him, Thou art old and stricken in years, and there remaineth yet very much land to be possessed.
verses.ct: Joshua had grown very old, and the LORD said to him, "You have reached an advanced age, and there is still a great deal of land left to be taken."

verses.kjv: This is the land that yet remaineth: all the borders of the Philistines, and all Geshuri,
verses.ct: This is the territory that still remains: all the regions of the Philistines and all of Geshuri,

verses.kjv: From Sihor, which is before Egypt, even unto the borders of Ekron northward, which is counted to the Canaanite: five lords of the Philistines; the Gazathites, and the Ashdothites, the Eshkalonites, the Gittites, and the Ekronites; also the Avites:
verses.ct: from the Shihor River east of Egypt all the way north to the border of Ekron — territory considered Canaanite. This includes the 5 Philistine rulers: those of Gaza, Ashdod, Ashkelon, Gath, and Ekron, as well as the Avites

verses.kjv: From the south, all the land of the Canaanites, and Mearah that is beside the Sidonians unto Aphek, to the borders of the Amorites:
verses.ct: to the south. It also includes all the Canaanite territory, and Mearah that belongs to the Sidonians, extending to Aphek and reaching the Amorite border,

verses.kjv: And the land of the Giblites, and all Lebanon, toward the sunrising, from Baalgad under mount Hermon unto the entering into Hamath.
verses.ct: plus the land of the Giblites and all of Lebanon to the east, from Baalgad below Mount Hermon all the way to the entrance of Hamath.

verses.kjv: All the inhabitants of the hill country from Lebanon unto Misrephothmaim, and all the Sidonians, them will I drive out from before the children of Israel: only divide thou it by lot unto the Israelites for an inheritance, as I have commanded thee.
verses.ct: "I myself will drive out all the people living in the hill country from Lebanon to Misrephothmaim, including all the Sidonians, ahead of the Israelites. All you need to do is distribute the land by lot to Israel as their inheritance, just as I commanded you."

verses.kjv: Now therefore divide this land for an inheritance unto the nine tribes, and the half tribe of Manasseh,
verses.ct: "So now, divide this land as an inheritance among the 9 tribes and the half-tribe of Manasseh."

verses.kjv: With whom the Reubenites and the Gadites have received their inheritance, which Moses gave them, beyond Jordan eastward, even as Moses the servant of the LORD gave them;
verses.ct: The other half of Manasseh, along with the Reubenites and Gadites, had already received their inheritance that Moses gave them on the east side of the Jordan, just as Moses the servant of the LORD had assigned it to them.

verses.kjv: From Aroer, that is upon the bank of the river Arnon, and the city that is in the midst of the river, and all the plain of Medeba unto Dibon;
verses.ct: Their territory ran from Aroer on the rim of the Arnon River valley, including the city in the middle of the valley, and the entire plateau of Medeba as far as Dibon.

verses.kjv: And all the cities of Sihon king of the Amorites, which reigned in Heshbon, unto the border of the children of Ammon;
verses.ct: It included all the cities of Sihon, king of the Amorites, who ruled in Heshbon, extending to the border of the Ammonites.

verses.kjv: And Gilead, and the border of the Geshurites and Maachathites, and all mount Hermon, and all Bashan unto Salcah;
verses.ct: It also included Gilead, the territory of the Geshurites and Maacathites, all of Mount Hermon, and all of Bashan as far as Salcah —

verses.kjv: All the kingdom of Og in Bashan, which reigned in Ashtaroth and in Edrei, who remained of the remnant of the giants: for these did Moses smite, and cast them out.
verses.ct: the entire kingdom of Og in Bashan, who ruled in Ashtaroth and Edrei. Og was one of the last surviving Rephaites. Moses had defeated these kings and driven them out.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless the children of Israel expelled not the Geshurites, nor the Maachathites: but the Geshurites and the Maachathites dwell among the Israelites until this day.
verses.ct: However, the Israelites did not force out the Geshurites or the Maacathites, so the people of Geshur and Maacath continue to live among the Israelites to this day.

verses.kjv: Only unto the tribe of Levi he gave none inheritance; the sacrifices of the LORD God of Israel made by fire are their inheritance, as he said unto them.
verses.ct: The tribe of Levi was the only one that received no land as an inheritance. Instead, the fire offerings made to the LORD, the God of Israel, were their inheritance, just as he had told them.

verses.kjv: And Moses gave unto the tribe of the children of Reuben inheritance according to their families.
verses.ct: Moses had given territory to the tribe of Reuben, distributed by their family groups.

verses.kjv: And their coast was from Aroer, that is on the bank of the river Arnon, and the city that is in the midst of the river, and all the plain by Medeba;
verses.ct: Their territory stretched from Aroer on the rim of the Arnon River valley, including the city in the middle of the valley, and the entire plateau near Medeba.

verses.kjv: Heshbon, and all her cities that are in the plain; Dibon, and Bamothbaal, and Bethbaalmeon,
verses.ct: This included Heshbon and all its surrounding towns on the plateau: Dibon, Bamoth Baal, Beth Baal Meon,

verses.kjv: And Jahaza, and Kedemoth, and Mephaath,
verses.ct: Jahaza, Kedemoth, Mephaath,

verses.kjv: And Kirjathaim, and Sibmah, and Zarethshahar in the mount of the valley,
verses.ct: Kirjathaim, Sibmah, and Zareth Shahar on the hill overlooking the valley,

verses.kjv: And Bethpeor, and Ashdothpisgah, and Bethjeshimoth,
verses.ct: Beth Peor, the slopes of Pisgah, and Beth Jeshimoth —

verses.kjv: And all the cities of the plain, and all the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, which reigned in Heshbon, whom Moses smote with the princes of Midian, Evi, and Rekem, and Zur, and Hur, and Reba, which were dukes of Sihon, dwelling in the country.
verses.ct: all the towns of the plateau and the entire kingdom of Sihon, king of the Amorites, who ruled in Heshbon. Moses had defeated him along with the Midianite chiefs Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba — princes allied with Sihon who lived in that region.

verses.kjv: Balaam also the son of Beor, the soothsayer, did the children of Israel slay with the sword among them that were slain by them.
verses.ct: The Israelites also killed Balaam son of Beor, the diviner, with the sword, along with the others they struck down.

verses.kjv: And the border of the children of Reuben was Jordan, and the border thereof. This was the inheritance of the children of Reuben after their families, the cities and the villages thereof.
verses.ct: The western boundary for the tribe of Reuben was the Jordan River. This was the inheritance of the Reubenites by their family groups — the cities and their surrounding villages.

verses.kjv: And Moses gave inheritance unto the tribe of Gad, even unto the children of Gad according to their families.
verses.ct: Moses also gave territory to the tribe of Gad, distributed by their family groups.

verses.kjv: And their coast was Jazer, and all the cities of Gilead, and half the land of the children of Ammon, unto Aroer that is before Rabbah;
verses.ct: Their territory included Jazer, all the cities of Gilead, and half the land of the Ammonites, reaching to Aroer near Rabbah.

verses.kjv: And from Heshbon unto Ramathmizpeh, and Betonim; and from Mahanaim unto the border of Debir;
verses.ct: It stretched from Heshbon to Ramath Mizpeh and Betonim, and from Mahanaim to the border of Debir.

verses.kjv: And in the valley, Betharam, and Bethnimrah, and Succoth, and Zaphon, the rest of the kingdom of Sihon king of Heshbon, Jordan and his border, even unto the edge of the sea of Chinnereth on the other side Jordan eastward.
verses.ct: In the valley it included Beth Haram, Beth Nimrah, Succoth, and Zaphon — the rest of the kingdom of Sihon, king of Heshbon. The Jordan River served as the western boundary, extending north to the edge of the Sea of Chinnereth on the east side of the Jordan.

verses.kjv: This is the inheritance of the children of Gad after their families, the cities, and their villages.
verses.ct: This was the inheritance of the Gadites by their family groups — the cities and their surrounding villages.

verses.kjv: And Moses gave inheritance unto the half tribe of Manasseh: and this was the possession of the half tribe of the children of Manasseh by their families.
verses.ct: Moses also gave territory to the half-tribe of Manasseh, distributed by their family groups.

verses.kjv: And their coast was from Mahanaim, all Bashan, all the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, and all the towns of Jair, which are in Bashan, threescore cities:
verses.ct: Their territory stretched from Mahanaim and included all of Bashan — the entire kingdom of Og, king of Bashan — along with all the settlements of Jair in Bashan, 60 cities in total.

verses.kjv: And half Gilead, and Ashtaroth, and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan, were pertaining unto the children of Machir the son of Manasseh, even to the one half of the children of Machir by their families.
verses.ct: Half of Gilead, plus Ashtaroth and Edrei, the royal cities of Og's kingdom in Bashan, were given to the descendants of Machir son of Manasseh — specifically to half the family groups of Machir.

verses.kjv: These are the countries which Moses did distribute for inheritance in the plains of Moab, on the other side Jordan, by Jericho, eastward.
verses.ct: These are the territories that Moses distributed as inheritances while on the plains of Moab, across the Jordan east of Jericho.

verses.kjv: But unto the tribe of Levi Moses gave not any inheritance: the LORD God of Israel was their inheritance, as he said unto them.
verses.ct: But Moses did not give any land inheritance to the tribe of Levi. The LORD, the God of Israel, himself was their inheritance, just as he had promised them.
